abstracts.cdata!:
The project completed satisfactorily all
            four components and achieved its objectives. The lessons
            learned about reform and privatization include: a) the
            strategy for power sector reform should be designed with
            consideration to the potential size of a neighboring
            regional market. b) Sector policy and regulatory reform
            should be well underway before privatization in the sector.
            c) The government's reform and privatization team
            should be staffed with qualified top level staff, with
            proven commitment to the reform. d) it is often better to
            break up large companies. e) Full attention must be paid to
            public relations. f) Top-level political support is critical
            for the success of the reform and privatization process.
            Lessons learned about bank lending include: 1) The Bank
            should be proactive in its sectoral dialogue and prepared to
            take the time to bring up to speed government officials of
            new administrations. 2) The loan should not become effective
            unless the project executing unit is in place. 3) In the
            event that the Bank is not successful in persuading the
            Borrower to use new procurement procedures, the Borrower
            should be given the option of using the old procedures spelt
            out in the loan agreement. 4) Adequate use of consultant
            services for diagnostic studies prior to project
            implementation is advisable. 5) While executing project
            contracts, the technical staff should also focus on
            administrative and legal matters in addition to technical matters.
